description: Provides a user with the Blink Abiiity.
name: Blink Boots

description: This armor reduces how much damage you take by 1d6 - 3.
name: Chaotic Armor

description: This ring makes people obedient when worn.
name: Obedience Ring

description: This plant will start growing vines rapidly as soon as it is exposed to light, moisture and air.
name: Infinity Vine

description: Once a session, the adventurer's pouch produces a single non-magical item.
name: Adventuers Pouch

description: Once a session, this figure of a puppy comes to life for an hour.
name: Alabaster Puppy

description: This appears as a small glass orb with a white platform inside of it. When the orb is rubbed, anything the holder is touching and anything the orb is touching will be transported onto the platform inside it. People in the pocket dimension can leave whenever they wish by walking off the platform.
name: All-Purpose Pocket Dimension

description: These gloves can provide sentience to any object less than 10 cubic feet for 10 minutes. The object will sprout a mouth and eyes and have an intelligence of 10. This can be used once per session.
name: Gloves of Temporary Sentience

description: This stone allows the owner to sacrifice HP to do more damage. Each point of HP provided to the bloodstone is an addition 1 point of damage.
name: Bloodstone

description: This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents
name: Bag of Holding

description: When opened, this bottle magically continually produces bees. The bees will be confused for a minute before attacking whoever is nearby.
name: Bottle of Bees

description: When you are attacked, you instantly teleport right next to the thing that attacked you and can take an action immediately afterwards
name: Amulet of Answering

description: Recover 1/5 of damage dealt as health
name: Ring of Vampirism

description: This gauntlet-like tool can be used to grab a creature or object from afar, and then either pull you towards the target or pull the target to you.
name: Clawshot

description: This cloak makes the wearer invisible when they are in shadow.
name: Cloak of the Shadowalker

description: This item is incapable of cutting living things, but it can cut through even stone and metal with ease.
name: Harmless Knife

description: When the wearer falls unconscious, this cocoon hardens into a stiff protective layer that reduces damage by 10
name: Cocoon Cloak

description: You gain one extra attribute point at the cost of hearing voices. The voices will sometimes provide secret information that is true, thus giving the wearer a greater sense of madness.
name: Crown of Madness

description: This monocle allows you to see through walls and obstacles.
name: X-ray monocle

description: This cookie gives you a glimpse into something that's coming up. The DM reveals a clue about an upcoming trigger
name: Fortune Cookie

description: When you put this ring on someone's finger, they will become infatuated with you. However, the effect is removed once they take the ring off.
name: Ring of Aphrodite

description: Any thing that hits this mirror will be absorbed into it. THe user can then send that attack out of the mirror. This mirror shatters after one use.
name: Mirror of Retaliation

description: This amulet provides a 25% chance of casting spells a second time.
name: Echo Amulet

description: This intimidating mask adds +2 to fear based persuasion, but subtracts 2 from positive persuasion.
name: Oni Mask

description: This scroll allows you to copy your mind into an inanimate object. This works a lot like the gloves of termporary sentience, but is permanent.
name: Scroll of Sentience Copying

description: This armor teleports you to a random location 1d6 squares away whenever you're hit.
name: Teleportation Armor

description: Players can choose to experience two more encounters in order to find some hidden treasure. The treasure will consist of a magical item and some gold.  2/5ths of the time, the treasure will already be taken.
name: Treasure Map

description: This stone works like a polygraph for who ever is holding it. This doesn't measure the truthness of the person holding it, rather it measures anxiety. Green means low anxiety, red means high anxiety and yellow is in between.
name: Polygraph stone

description: This amulet provides control over a shield guardian. No matter where the amulet is in relation to a guardian, the guadian will be able to go to the amulet bearer if it is summoned.
name: Shield Guardian Amulet

description: This simple screwdriver can transform into a variety of tools; as an action, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of artisan's tool of your choice
name: All Purpose Tool

description: To use to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.While the tattoo is on your skin, you have resistance to a type of damage associated with that color. https://5e.tools/items.html#absorbing%20tattoo_tce
name: Absorbing Tattoo

description:
This ceramic jug appears to be able to hold a gallon of liquid and weighs 12 pounds whether full or empty. Sloshing sounds can be heard from within the jug when it is shaken, even if the jug is empty.

You can use an action and name one liquid from the table below to cause the jug to produce the chosen liquid. Afterward, you can uncork the jug as an action and pour that liquid out, up to 2 gallons per minute. The maximum amount of liquid the jug can produce depends on the liquid you named. https://5e.tools/items.html#alchemy%20jug_dmg
name: Alchemy Jug

description: This amulet smells of old, ale-stained wood. While wearing it, you can regain 4d4 + 4 hit points when you drink a pint of beer, ale, mead, or wine
name: Amulet of the drunkard

description: While holding this shield, you can speak its command word as a bonus action to cause it to animate. The shield leaps into the air and hovers in your space to protect you as if you were wielding it, leaving your hands free.
name: Animated Shield

description: This keyrune is carved from white marble and lapis lazuli to resemble a noble bird of prey. It can become a giant eagle for up to 1 hour.
name: Azorius Keyrune

description: Inside this heavy cloth bag are 3d4 dry beans. The bag weighs ½ pound plus ¼ pound for each bean it contains. If you remove a bean from the bag, plant it in dirt or sand, and then water it, the bean produces an effect 1 minute later from the ground where it was planted. The DM can choose an effect from the following table, determine it randomly, or create an effect. https://5e.tools/items.html#bag%20of%20beans_dmg
name: Bag of Beans

description: This bag superficially resembles a bag of holding but is a feeding orifice for a gigantic extradimensional creature. Turning the bag inside out closes the orifice. https://5e.tools/items.html#bag%20of%20devouring_dmg
name: Bag of Devouring

description: When worn, your footsteps make no sound regardless of how you walk, run, and regardless of what the floor is made of.
name: Boots of SIlence

description:
This translucent, bubble-like sphere has a slightly tacky outer surface, and you gain the item's benefits only while wearing it over your head like a helmet.

The bubble contains 1 hour of breathable air. The bubble regains all its expended air daily at dawn.
name: Breathing Bubble

description: https://5e.tools/items.html#carpet%20of%20flying%2c%203%20ft.%20%c3%97%205%20ft._dmg
name: Flying Carpet

description: If water is poured into the cauldron and stirred for 1 minute, it transforms into a hearty, hot stew, which can provide one nourishing meal for up to four people per gallon. https://5e.tools/items.html#cauldron%20of%20plenty_idrotf
name: Cauldron of Plenty

description: Whenever you roll this six—sided die, you can control which number it rolls.
name: Charlatan's Die

description: This hollow metal tube measures about 1 foot long and weighs 1 pound. You can strike it as an action, pointing it at an object within 120 feet of you that can be opened, such as a door, lid, or lock. The chime issues a clear tone, and one lock or latch on the object opens unless the sound can't reach the object. If no locks or latches remain, the object itself opens. https://5e.tools/items.html#chime%20of%20opening_dmg
name: Chime of Opening

description: The Circlet of Human Perfection transforms its attuned wearer into an attractive human of average height and weight. The circlet chooses the physical characteristics of the form, such as age, gender, skin color, hair color, and voice. https://5e.tools/items.html#circlet%20of%20human%20perfection_wdmm
name: Circlet of Human Perfection

description: A cleansing stone is a sphere 1 foot in diameter, engraved with mystic sigils. When touching the stone, you can use an action to activate it and remove dirt and grime from your garments and your person.
name: Cleansing Stone

description: While wearing this cloak, you can use a bonus action to make it billow dramatically.
name: Cloak of Billowing

description: While you wear this cloak, it projects an illusion that makes you appear to be standing in a place near your actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against you. If you take damage, the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while you are incapacitated, restrained, or otherwise unable to move
name: Cloak of Displacement

description: While wearing this cloak, you can pull its hood over your head to cause yourself to become invisible. While you are invisible, anything you are carrying or wearing is invisible with you. You become visible when you cease wearing the hood. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.https://5e.tools/items.html#cloak%20of%20invisibility_dmg
name: Cloak of Invisibility

description: While wearing this cloak, you can use a bonus action to change the style, color, and apparent quality of the garment. The cloak's weight doesn't change. Regardless of its appearance, the cloak can't be anything but a cloak. Although it can duplicate the appearance of other magic cloaks, it doesn't gain their magical properties.
name: Cloak of Many Fashions

description: Once a day, you can guarantee an average roll.
name: Clockwork Amulet

description: You can use an action to remove the stopper and speak one of three command words, whereupon an amount of fresh water or salt water (your choice) pours out of the flask. The water stops pouring out at the start of your next turn. https://5e.tools/items.html#decanter%20of%20endless%20water_dmg
name: Decanter of Endless Water

description: Smoke leaks from the lead-stoppered mouth of this brass bottle, which weighs 1 pound. When you use an action to remove the stopper, a cloud of thick smoke pours out in a 60-foot radius from the bottle. https://5e.tools/items.html#eversmoking%20bottle_dmg
name: Eversmoking Bottle

description: When you fall at least 20 feet while the token is on your person, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling. The token's magic is expended after you land, whereupon the disk becomes nonmagical.
name: Feather Token

description: While wearing these dark lenses, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet.
name: Goggles of Night

description: Any poisonous liquid poured into the ewer is instantly transformed into an equal amount of sweet wine. Furthermore, a creature that grasps the ewer's handle can command the ewer to fill with 1 gallon of wine, and it can't produce more wine until the next dawn.
name: Green Copper Ewer

description: This flat iron rod has a button on one end. You can use an action to press the button, which causes the rod to become magically fixed in place. Until you or another creature uses an action to push the button again, the rod doesn't move, even if it is defying gravity. The rod can hold up to 8,000 pounds of weight. More weight causes the rod to deactivate and fall.
name: Immovable Rod

description: A question mark is worked into the head of this key. The key has a 5 percent chance of unlocking any lock into which it's inserted. Once it unlocks something, the key disappears.
name: Mystery Key

description: Used to summon night, this 6-inch-diameter, jet-black orb is cold to the touch. You can spend 10 minutes to activate it, causing the area within 10 miles of it at the moment of activation to become night even if it is daytime. This night lasts for 24 hours, until you cancel it as an action, or until your attunement to the pearl ends. Once used, the pearl can't be used again for 24 hours.
name: Nightfall Pearl

description: When you complete the painting, the object or terrain feature depicted becomes a real, nonmagical object. Thus, painting a door on a wall creates an actual door that can be opened to whatever is beyond. Painting a pit on a floor creates a real pit, and its depth counts against the total area of objects you create. https://5e.tools/items.html#nolzur's%20marvelous%20pigments_dmg
name: Nolzur's Marvelous Pigments

description: After you write a message of fifty words or fewer on this magic sheet of parchment and speak a creature's name, the parchment magically folds into a Tiny paper bird and flies to the recipient whose name you uttered.https://5e.tools/items.html#paper%20bird_wdh
name: Paper Bird

description: You are immune to contracting any disease while you wear this pendant. If you are already infected with a disease, the effects of the disease are suppressed while you wear the pendant.
name: Periapt of Health

description: a solid surface, whereupon the portable hole creates an extradimensional hole 10 feet deep. The cylindrical space within the hole exists on a different plane, so it can't be used to create open passages. Any creature inside an open portable hole can exit the hole by climbing out of it.https://5e.tools/items.html#portable%20hole_dmg
name: Portable Hole

description:
The portfolio keeper holds and organizes notes, brochures, and business cards bearing your contact information. It also has an inexhaustible supply of brochures related to your franchise's current branding scheme.

When you meet someone for the first time, their details and a rough sketch are magically stored on a small parchment card in the portfolio keeper. You can access the details of any such stored card as a bonus action.
name: Portfolio Keeper

description:
The robe lets you see in all directions, and you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
You have darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.
You can see invisible creatures and objects, as well as see into the Ethereal Plane, out to a range of 120 feet.https://5e.tools/items.html#robe%20of%20eyes_dmg
name: Robe of eyes

description: You can cut this 50-foot coil of hempen rope into any number of smaller pieces, and then use an action to speak a command word and cause the pieces to knit back together. The pieces must be in contact with each other and not otherwise in use. A rope of mending is forever shortened if a section of it is lost or destroyed.
name: Rope of Mending

description:
Once per day as a bonus action, a villain can activate the ruinstone to undo one deed they have performed. The possibilities here are broad, but in combat it's simplest to allow them the opportunity to "rewind" one action and take it again, or to reroll a failed saving throw (if it can still take actions).

Each use of the artifact has a terrible side effect: someone known to the wielder is also erased from reality. https://5e.tools/items.html#ruinstone_dc
name: Ruinstone

description: You can use this pen to write on any surface. You decide whether the writing is visible or invisible, but the writing is always visible to a person with the Mark of Scribing. https://5e.tools/items.html#scribe's%20pen_erlw
name: Scribe Pen

description: When you whisper the word "seek" and hurl this dart, it seeks out a target of your choice within 120 feet of you. https://5e.tools/items.html#seeker%20dart_pota
name: Seeker Dart

description: While you wear these light shoes, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. However, the slippers don't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.
name: Slippers of Spider Climbing

description: You are the beneficiary of a whisper jar—a common magic item resembling an ether-filled jar with a long tap hose. The jar is used to record others' stories and your own observations, like a verbal notebook with unlimited space. The whisper jar records as fast as a creature can speak into it, and whispers back words at the same pace they were recorded. Activating the playback of a particular recording is an action.
name: Whisper Jar

description:
While you wear these boots, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can use the boots to fly for up to 4 hours, all at once or in several shorter flights, each one using a minimum of 1 minute from the duration. If you are flying when the duration expires, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you land.

The boots regain 2 hours of flying capability for every 12 hours they aren't in use.
name: Winged Boots

description: This will heal someone my a little bit.
name: Healing Herbs

description: Standard Ass Zombie
name: Zombie

description: A blink dog takes its name from its ability to blink in and out of existence, a talent it uses to aid its attacks and to avoid harm.
name: Blink Dog

description: Displacer beasts were large cat-like creatures, sometimes described as panther or puma-like with six legs and a pair of long tentacles sprouting from their shoulders. They were covered in a pelt of blue-black fur. They were usually about 9 feet long and weighed as much as 500 pounds. Displacer beasts used their innate magic to bend light, making them appear to be a foot or two from their actual positions
name: Displacer Beast

description: A monstrous cross between giant owl and bear, an owlbear’s reputation for ferocity and aggression makes it one of the most feared predators of the wild.
name: Owlbear

description: Taking its name from its crimson feathers and aggressive nature, the blood hawk fearlessly attacks almost any animal, stabbing it with its daggerlike beak. Blood hawks flock together in large numbers, attacking as a pack to take down prey.
name: Blood Hawk

description: This character is a brain in a jar. I am going to write a backstory and personality for this character. The undead horrors known as brains in a jar are simultaneously incredibly powerful and incredibly feeble. Their mental prowess is superior to that of any but the most gifted mortal, and their wide array of magical and psychic powers allow them to wither the bodies and minds of their enemies. Their corporeal forms, however, are limited to a barely motile brain encased in a jar of fluid. Although they can move and protect this jar with their psychic powers, they are extremely weak and relatively fragile. This dichotomy drives many brains in a jar to build a host of thralls, both mortal and undead, to protect them and distract their enemies. https://thecreaturecodex.tumblr.com/post/153867127450/brain-in-a-jar
name: Brain in a Jar Character

description: A ghost is the soul of a once-living creature, bound to haunt a specific location, creature, or object that held significance to it in its life. https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/ghost
name: Ghost

description: A slime is an animal that looks like a gelatinous ball absorbs things and dissolves them inside its body. They are amorphous and can change shape very easily. it's able to absorb most physical attacks, but is vulnerable to magical attacks.
name: Slime

description: Mimics are monsters that look like ordinary valuable objects until they attack. They will be able to bite, bludgeon, or grab things.
name: Mimic

description: Wights are intelligent undead humanoids that resemble armed and armored corpses. They never tire in pursuit of their goal of making eternal war against the living. https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/wight
name: Wight

description: A shambling mound, sometimes called a shambler, trudges ponderously through bleak swamps, dismal marshes, and rain forests, consuming any organic matter in its path. This rotting heap of animated vegetation looms up half again as tall as a human, tapering into a faceless “head” at its top. https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/shambling-mound
name: Shambling Mound

description: An assassin vine is an ambulatory plant that collects its fertilizer by grabbing and crushing prey and depositing the carcasses near its roots. It usually stays put unless it needs to seek out prey. A mature plant consists of a main vine, about 20 feet long. Smaller vines up to 5 feet long branch from the main vine every 6 inches. In late summer, the secondary vines produce bunches of small fruits that resemble wild grapes. The fruit is tough and has a hearty but bitter flavor. https://5e.tools/bestiary/assassin-vine-toa.html
name: Assassin Vine

description:
This creature is a collection of plant matter grown in the shape of a humanoid, walking on fibrous tendrils and with a stalk for a neck. Its head is a set of jaw, like the mouth of a Venus flytrap but much bigger. Its vine-like arms grow around a polearm.

Flytrap soldiers are carnivorous plants crafted through magic to serve as steadfast and replaceable troops. https://thecreaturecodex.tumblr.com/post/644500184624136192/flytrap-soldier
name: Flytrap Solider

description:
This creature has a small star-shaped body covered in armor, and five long spiny tendrils. It has no apparent eyes, but acts as if it can see perfectly well.

Giant brittle stars live along the water’s edge. Unlike their mundane kin, they are carnivorous, but their small mouths mean that they have to tear prey to tiny pieces in order to ingest it. Their spiked arms can accomplish this task suitably, and their armored exoskeleton deters attackers long enough to make their assault. Horrifyingly, a giant brittle star can detach its arms, which can slither away or fight on their own. It usually uses this ability when surrounded or overwhelmed, and may attempt to escape and leave behind an arm as a decoy. https://thecreaturecodex.tumblr.com/post/645677912393187328/brittle-star-giant
name: Giant Brittle Star

description: This creature looks like it was once humanoid, but is in the process of dissolving into an amorphous mass of flesh. Its skeleton is visible beneath its running features. https://thecreaturecodex.tumblr.com/post/644319010480144384/melting-menace
name: Melting Menace

description: We've all seen Harry Potter, we all know what this is
name: Basilisk

description: https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/clay-golem
name: Clay Golem

description: Magic squids that fall on their prey and create darkness: https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/darkmantle
name: Darkmantle

description:
Ettercaps are humanoid spiders that tend, feed, and watch over spiders the way a shepherd oversees a flock of sheep. They lair deep in remote forests.

Fine strands of silk stream from glands in an ettercap’s abdomen, letting it shoot sticky strands of webbing to bind, entrap, or strangle its victims. It can also use its webbing to fashion elaborate snares and nets, which often festoon its lair.https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/ettercap
name: Ettercap Character

description: https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/flying-snake
name: Flying Snake

description: A funneling cloud of whirling air with a vague semblance of a face, they can turn themselves into a screaming cyclone, creating a whirlwind that batters creatures even as it flings them away. https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/dust-devil
name: Dust Devil

description: An invisible stalker is an air elemental that has been summoned from its native plane and transformed by powerful magic. Its sole purpose is to hunt down creatures and retrieve objects for its summoner. When it is defeated or the magic that binds it expires, an invisible stalker vanishes in a gust of wind.https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/invisible-stalker
name: Invisile Stalker

description: https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/mummy
name: Mummy

description: The elusive pseudodragon dwells in the quiet places of the world, making its home in the hollows of trees and small caves. With its red-brown scales, horns, and a maw filled with sharp teeth, a pseudodragon resembles a tiny red dragon but its disposition is playful.https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/pseudodragon
name: Psuedodragon

description: https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/purple-worm.
name: Sandworm

description:
Living in caves and caverns throughout the Underdark, voracious ropers feast on whatever they can catch and seize. A roper eats any creature, from Underdark beasts to adventurers and their gear.

A roper has the appearance of a stalagmite or stalactite, which often allows it to attack with surprise. The creature can move slowly using thousands of sticky cilia beneath its base. It creeps up cave walls and along stone ceilings, finding the best position from which to attack. https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/roper
name: Roper

description:
Shadows are undead that resemble dark exaggerations of humanoid shadows.

From the darkness, the shadow reaches out to feed on living creatures’ vitality. https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/shadow
name: Shadow

description:
Would-be thieves and careless heroes arrive at the doorsteps of an enemy’s abode, eyes and ears alert for traps, only to end their quest prematurely as the rugs beneath their feet animate and smother them to death.

A rug of smothering can be made in many different forms, from a finely woven carpet fit for a queen to a coarse mat in a peasant’s hovel. Creatures with the ability to sense magic detect the rug’s false magical aura.https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/rug-of-smothering
name: Rug of Smothering

description:
Most dwarves would rather face a squad of orcs than confront a single rust monster. These strange, normally docile creatures corrode ferrous metals, then gobble up the rust they create. In doing so, they have ruined the armor, shields, and weapons of countless adventurers.

A rust monster’s body is covered in thick, lumpy armor, its long tail ends in a bony protrusion, and two feathery antennae sprout from its insectile head. https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/rust-monster
name: Rust Monster

description: Wizards and other spellcasters create shield guardians for protection. A shield guardian treads beside its master, absorbing damage to keep its master alive as long as possible. A shield guardian defends whoever as the amulet associated with the guardian.
name: Shield Guardian

description: A shrieker is a human-sized mushroom that emits a piercing screech to drive off creatures that disturb it. Other creatures use the fungi as an alarm to signal the approach of prey, and various intelligent races of the Underdark cultivate shriekers on the outskirts of their communities to discourage trespassers. https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/shrieker
name: Shrieker

description: This cat is ordinary in almost every way. However, every character that sees this cat must roll for constitution. If they do not get more than 10, they feel compelled to steal this cat
name: Cute Cat

description:
This horrid flying creature looks like a cross between a large bat and an oversized mosquito. Its legs end in sharp pincers, and its long, needle-like proboscis slashes the air as it seeks its next meal.

Stirges feed on the blood of living creatures, attaching and draining them slowly. Although they pose little danger in small numbers, packs of stirges can be a formidable threat, reattaching as quickly as their weakening prey can pluck them off. https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/stirge
name: Stirge

description: Bizarre creatures native to the Elemental Plane of Earth, xorn sniff out gemstones and precious metals, then tunnel through earth and rock to consume those treasures. On the Material Plane, xorn must range far and wide through the Underdark to sustain themselves, becoming aggressive toward miners and treasure hunters when the valuable minerals of their diet are scarce.https://www.dndbeyond.com/monsters/xorn
name: Xorn

description: Obsessed with gathering secrets, both from the gods they inhabit and from the bones of dead creatures, they call forth the spirits of the dead and force them to divulge what they learned in life. https://5e.tools/bestiary.html#berbalang_mtf
name: Berbalang Character

description: This stern, humorless doctor takes her work very seriously. She sees most people as obstacles who are likely to get in his way. She travels with 1d3 guards. Initially, her attitude towards people will be to scorn and mistrust them, but as she opens up, she'll feel more comfortable asking for help and providing healing or healing supplies.
name: Dr Skye Faulk

description: This fun, easygoing paladin can frequently be found in a good mood, mostly because he thinks he's better than others and because he believes that he has that power and authority to do whatever he wants. He expects others to defer to his authority and will get upset when they don't.
name: Zain Schuler

description: This orphan looks like a child down on his luck, but he'll use his crocadile tears to swindle anyone he encounters. He's lived on the streets for a while, knows how to con people pretty well and distrusts most people, but he's still just a kid that wants a home and a family.
name: Hayden Devlin

description: This assasin rookie is still learning how to be an effective assasin, but she's determined to prove herself to her guild. Her insecurities make her controlling and untrusting, but her desire to grow and improve might manage to push her to conquer those anxieties
name: Sana Mireles

description: This duchess is also the leader of the Assasin's Guild. She uses her political position and social know-how in order to.have targets murdered without doing any dirty work. Others can rarely tell what her true feelings or intentions are.
name: Amelie Arndt

description: This character is actually a spy and will lie about who they are and what they're doing. Their lie should be comically transparent. The DM should hastily make up a new persona for them each time they're encountered
name: Kian Cooney

description: Though he might seem like a hippie that only cares about partying at first, this highly-accomplished wizard believes psychadelic drugs will reveal the secrets of the universe to him.
name: Felix Sun

description: This young introverted necromancer is more comfortable around bodies than they are around people. They care about their re-animations more than they care about most people. They usually have a few re-animations with them. They're often looking for new bodies to turn into friends and will be overjoyed if you bring a fresh body to them.
name: Finn Wilburn

description: This guard is a master swordsman who just wants to keep her head down and earn enough money that her family will have a good life. She deliberately resists getting involved with any organizations or shenanigans
name: Sian Newkirk

description: This enthusastic saleswoman is eager to swindle adventurers into buying her broken, derelict and sometimes dangerous wares.
name: Robyn Ricker

description: This outgoing jovial martial artist is primarily concerned with finding the strongest people she can find and fighting them.
name: Willow Orourke

description: This young merchant has recently inherited his family's business. He's anxious about living up to expecations but he's going to try his best!
name: Edgar Gant

description: This kindly drunkard priest believes that hedonism and enjoyment of life are the true ways of communing with God.
name: Peyton Farrington

description: This kindly priest travels and provides aid to those in need, but can't help but be frustrated by the injust actions of the Church
name: Mason Weatherford

description: This kindly hermit is actually a cannibal that provides people with hospitality and a place to stay before he kills them in their sleep.
name: Earl Keeton

description: This flirtatious druid is actually an eco terrorist.
name: Lee Iverson

description: This cultist is enthusiastically trying to recruit new cultists. She's a little too chipper and a little too helpful, like Jehovah's Witnesses or Mormons. She's not brainwashed -  she's genuinely fairly happy being in the cult and with the community that it's provided for her. That community just happens to be focused around worshipping and carrying out the will of a real elder god that wants to make the world theirs
name: Willow Luce

description: This basic witch loves pumpkin spice potions, gossip, and drama and will use her powers to stir shit up for her entertainment.
name: Ashleigh Dove

description: This traveling clown is the saddest person the adventurers will meet on their journey. He's poor, completely helpless, and universally hated for no good reason.
name: Adrian Bedford

description: This alchemist externally makes her living selling potions and elixers but is secretly a drug kingpin. She's got a no-nonense pragmatic attitude which has helped her be successful.
name: Iris Harp

description: This lazy assassin is actually one of the best in the business. She considers assassinations to be a hassle and will put as little effort into the job as possible.
name: Lyla Burk

description: This good spirited bard is actually a lich, who is using his songs to get humans to generate magical energy for him.
name: Syed Boudreaux

description: This vampire just wants to get fucked up with his bros and party. He doesn't like eating humans cause it would harsh the vibe and also reduce the number of bros to party with
name: Filip Vallejo

description: This nobleman can't help but sound sarcastic despite being genuinely sincere most of the time.
name: Finnan Seaton

description: When this character first appears, they have identical stats and skills as a character in your party. They are that character's rival. Their entire life besting that character and they get a little hurt when the players disregard them.
name: Sam Swann

description: This fighter will act as a tsundere towards a random character in the players party
name: Ali Stoll

description: Despite being mostly normal, this girl's pale skin, awkward demeonor, and unkempt appearance make her quite creepy.
name: Alayna Gresham

description: This adventurer is an influencer who thrives off fame and renown. Sure, they're not the most capable adventurer, but they don't care about that.
name: Drake Ellington

description: I came up with this name, but haven't thought of a character to associate.
name: Maja Bronson

description: Social Activism organization trying to distribute literature and content fighting against Imperialist racial stereotypes. In this world, the standard monster descriptions are imperialist propaganda used to keep races separated. Magically detected Good and Evil are actually just based on what Imperialists have deemed good and evil.
Cat-ish character that has a nine lives. However, the nine lives are lived in parallel in 9 different worlds.
https://thecreaturecodex.tumblr.com/post/645587333968740352/glitterskull
name: Example Glitterskull Character

description: The assassin's guild is something like a worker's union for assassins that's designed to create systems of mutual support and benefit. Without this kind of system, assassins are simply incetivized to target each other to minimize their competition. However, with the assassin's guild, dues are collected and used to make and establish improvements that benefit all assassins in the assassin's guild. These benefits include pension plans, protection plans, client management and communication, clean up services, supplier deals, etc.
name: Assaasin's Guild

description: Works as an operations manager at the Assassin's guild. Briefly speaking, she makes sure that assassins and clients get the information they need. She does no assassinating on her own, but is under heavy protection within the guild. Her personality is confident and stern, but not humorless. She cares for her reports deeply, but has high expectations of them and has no problem pushing them to do their best
name: Fatimah Dominguez

description: This organization is devoted to the identification and containment of supernatural or unexplained phenomena. Well understood magic isn't really a priority of this organization nor are they a scientific organization. Their purpose is primarily pragmatic and action focused.
name: SCP Foundation

description: Imperialist Military Stand-in
name: Imperialists

description: Circus but is actually made up of elite spies.
name: tmp-name-1

description: Non Abusive cult. They are very good about boundaries and respect.
name: tmp-name-2

description: A society of poets that publish secrets in the form of cryptic messages hidden in their work
name: tmp-name-3

description: A test puzzle for testing the code that uses these rows
name: test puzzle

description: a test curse for the purpose of testing this code
name: test curse

description: GM can decide whether it's a fresh battlefield or old and mossed over
name: battlefield
